summary: An instructional video demonstrating how to request the temporary hiding of content in Google search results using the Google Search Console tool.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing a bright yellow t-shirt, seated at a wooden table in a well-organized room. He is positioned in front of a laptop adorned with various stickers, including one that reads "Search Console." The table also holds a gray mug, a small figurine, and a notebook. Behind him, shelves display an assortment of items such as books, a blue object, and a framed picture of a wrench. The man appears to be speaking, as indicated by his hand gestures and facial expressions. The video transitions to a white screen with the text "Removals in Search Console" in black font, accompanied by a blue vertical line on the left side. The man continues to speak, and a text box appears on the screen with the words "ONLY temporary removal requests" in blue font, emphasizing the temporary nature of the removal requests being discussed. The video maintains a consistent setting and atmosphere throughout, with the man engaging in a discussion related to the topic of removals in Search Console.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker, who seems to be a professional, introducing himself as a search advocate at Google. He starts talking about the removal report in Search Console and how to use it. He makes it clear that the tool should only be used for temporary removal requests. Music then plays in the background, which is synth-heavy and has an upbeat and happy mood.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a bright yellow t-shirt is seated at a wooden desk in a well-organized room. He is positioned in front of a laptop adorned with various stickers, including one that reads "Subscribe." The desk also holds a gray mug, a small figurine, and a notebook. Behind him, shelves are neatly arranged with books, a basket, and other decorative items, while framed pictures of wrenches hang on the wall. The man appears to be speaking, as indicated by his hand gestures and facial expressions. At one point, a blue banner with white text appears on the screen, stating "Check it out" and "Links in the description below," suggesting that viewers can find additional information or resources in the video's description. The overall atmosphere is casual and inviting, with the man seemingly engaged in a conversation or presentation.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker introducing a video topic about permanent removal of pages from search and referring to links in the description for more details. The speaker clarifies the tool's function is limited to managing search results from the user's own website, directing the listener to further links for information on removing information from Google or the web. The speaker states they are now aligned on what can be removed and proceeds to discuss the removals report in Search Console, clarifying it's the topic of the discussion.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a bright yellow t-shirt is seated at a table, engaging in a conversation or presentation. The background features a well-organized shelf with various items, including books, a basket, and decorative objects, alongside framed pictures on the wall. A laptop adorned with stickers is visible on the right side of the frame. As the man speaks, text appears on the screen, listing topics such as 'Temporary removals,' 'Outdated content,' and 'SafeSearch filtering requests,' indicating the subject matter of his discussion. The scene transitions to a close-up of a Google search page, where the man's hands are seen typing into the search bar, suggesting he is demonstrating a search process. The video maintains a consistent, professional atmosphere throughout, with the man's gestures and expressions emphasizing his points.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker introducing the removal report, explaining that it is divided into three sections: temporary removals, outdated content, and safe search filtering requests. He proposes discussing each section to understand their usage. Subsequently, the sound of a liquid being poured into a glass can be heard.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a title card displaying the text "Temporary removals" in a clean, sans-serif font against a white background with a subtle grid pattern. A blue vertical line is positioned to the left of the text, adding a touch of color to the otherwise monochromatic design. The scene then transitions to a man wearing a bright yellow t-shirt, seated at a wooden desk in a well-organized room. The desk is adorned with a laptop covered in various stickers, a gray mug, and a small figurine. Behind him, shelves filled with books, decorative items, and framed pictures of tools create a cozy and intellectual atmosphere. The man appears to be speaking, as indicated by his hand gestures and facial expressions, suggesting he is engaged in a conversation or presentation. The video maintains a consistent setting throughout, with the man continuing to speak and gesture, emphasizing his points with hand movements. The background remains unchanged, reinforcing the continuity of the scene. The video concludes with the man still seated at the desk, maintaining his engaging demeanor, and the overall setting remains consistent, providing a coherent and focused narrative.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker explaining that a temporary removal request can be used to take content off Google Search. He mentions that successful requests last about six months, and he speaks in an informative tone. The clip ends with the sound of liquid pouring.

events_list.video_caption: The video showcases the Google Search Console interface, starting with an overview of the site's performance and coverage metrics. The performance graph indicates search queries over time, while the coverage section shows the number of pages with errors. The user navigates to the 'Removals' section, where they can manage requests to remove content from Google Search results. The interface displays a list of submitted requests, including a specific example of a URL being temporarily removed. The user then initiates a new request, selecting the option to remove a URL from search results. The video concludes with the user confirming the removal request, highlighting the process of managing and removing content from Google Search results through the Search Console.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker providing instructions on how to use the removals report in the search console. He describes the temporary removals tab and how to submit a new removal request. He then goes on to explain the two types of requests available: "temporarily remove URL" and "clear cached URL," detailing their respective functions and use cases. He emphasizes the importance of carefully considering requests for entire URL prefixes.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a view of the Google Search Console interface, specifically focusing on the 'Removals' section. A pop-up window titled 'Remove URL(s)' appears, asking the user to confirm the removal of a URL from Google Search results. The pop-up includes a warning message about the implications of removing content. The user is presented with two options: 'Cancel' and 'Submit request.' The background shows a list of submitted removal requests, with details such as the URL, type, request date, and status. The user clicks the 'Submit request' button, and the pop-up disappears, revealing the updated list of removal requests. The video then transitions to a new screen with the heading 'Outdated content,' indicating a shift in focus to managing outdated content within the Google Search Console. The background features a grid pattern, and the text is displayed in a clean, modern font.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker explaining the temporary removal section of a report, detailing the information displayed, such as URL, request type, date, and status. He also mentions the possibility to cancel a request. Subsequently, a distinct slurping sound interrupts the speech.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a yellow t-shirt is seated at a wooden table in a room with a gray wall and shelves filled with various items, including books, a small plant, and a framed picture of a wrench. He has a laptop with stickers on it, a gray mug, and a small figurine on the table. The man appears to be speaking, as his mouth moves and his hands are clasped together on the table. A text overlay appears on the screen, reading "Outdated cache removal" and then changes to "Outdated page removal." The scene transitions to a close-up of a computer screen displaying the Google Search Console interface, specifically the "Removals" section under "Sitemap errors." The interface shows a list of submitted requests with details such as the URL, the date submitted, and the status of the request. The man continues to speak, and the video maintains a consistent focus on the Google Search Console interface, emphasizing the process of removing outdated content from search results.
events_list.audio_caption: A male speaker with a neutral tone explains Google's outdated content section, removal requests, and two request types: outdated cache removal and outdated page removal. He also discusses the report table. He then recommends viewers check the description for additional information. The clip ends with the sound of someone taking a sip.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a yellow t-shirt sitting at a wooden table with a laptop adorned with stickers, a blue mug, and a small figurine. The background includes shelves with various items and framed pictures on the wall. The man appears to be speaking, as indicated by his hand gestures and facial expressions. The video transitions to a close-up of a Google search results page, displaying the text "SafeSearch filtering" in a white box with a blue vertical line on the left side. The search results show various images, including a person in a red shirt, a person in a blue shirt, and a person in a white shirt, with the text "SafeSearch filtering" visible in the search bar. The video then returns to the man at the table, with a Google Search Console page displayed on the laptop screen, showing a list of submitted requests and their statuses. The man continues to speak, maintaining a consistent setting and atmosphere throughout the video.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing SafeSearch features, explaining how it filters sexually explicit results and is used by families, workplaces, and schools. The speaker has a neutral tone. Following the explanation is a sound of a chewing or crunching nature.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a bright yellow t-shirt is seated at a wooden table in a well-organized room. He has a laptop adorned with various stickers in front of him, and his hands are clasped together on the table. To his left, there is a gray mug, a small figurine, and a red object, possibly a toy or a decorative item. The background features shelves with neatly arranged items, including books, a basket, and a blue object. Two framed pictures of wrenches hang on the wall, adding a touch of personality to the space. The man appears to be engaged in a conversation or presentation, as his facial expressions and hand gestures change throughout the video. The overall atmosphere is casual and inviting, with a focus on the man and his surroundings.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker stating that "permanent removals should not really be part of this video" because it's not required or reported by search console. He then continues with a more conversational tone, explaining that since they're discussing temporary removals so much, a short explanation might be in order.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a bright yellow t-shirt is seated at a wooden table in a room with a modern, organized aesthetic. The background features shelves with various items, including books, a small plant, and decorative objects, as well as framed pictures on the wall. On the table, there is a laptop adorned with stickers, a gray mug, and a small figurine. The man appears to be speaking, as indicated by his hand gestures and facial expressions. A text box appears on the screen, providing information about "permanent removal," which includes steps such as returning a 404 or 410 error, blocking access to the content, and using a noindex meta tag. The text box is white with black text, and the man continues to speak while the text is displayed, suggesting he is explaining the process or providing instructions related to the content on the screen. The overall atmosphere is educational and informative, with the man engaging the viewer through his presentation.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a single male speaker providing advice on removing content from Google search, emphasizing methods like removing content from the site or blocking access. His tone is informative and professional.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a bright yellow t-shirt is seated at a wooden table in a well-organized room. He has a beard and is looking directly at the camera with a neutral expression. His hands are clasped together on the table, and he appears to be engaged in a conversation or presentation. On the table, there is a laptop adorned with various stickers, a gray mug, and a small figurine resembling a white astronaut. The background features a dark curtain, a wall with shelves holding books, a basket, and other decorative items, as well as framed pictures of wrenches. The atmosphere is casual and professional, suggesting a home office or a creative workspace. Throughout the video, the man maintains a consistent posture and expression, indicating a steady and focused discussion.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a single male speaker in a neutral, informative tone, stating that redirecting an old page with a 301 response is not enough to remove it from Google search results, and that a robots.txt directive also won't work as a blocking mechanism. He then says, "And that's it, we're done for today".

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a yellow t-shirt is seated at a wooden table, with a laptop adorned with stickers and a gray mug in front of him. The background features shelves with various items and framed pictures on the wall. The man appears to be speaking, as his mouth moves and his hands gesture. A blue banner with the text "Subscribe YouTube.com/GoogleWebmasters" appears on the screen, prompting viewers to subscribe to the channel. The man then stands up, dons blue gloves, and picks up a plastic bag, seemingly preparing to clean or organize the area. The video maintains a casual and informative atmosphere, with the man engaging with the audience while demonstrating a task.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with an authoritative male voice, explaining "how to request to remove specific content on your site from Google search results". He continues describing how to "track these requests", speaking in an informative tone, then announces the topic of the next episode will be how to "check security issues on your website". The speaker encourages listeners to subscribe to the "Google Webmasters YouTube channel", and to "stay tuned". This is followed by light music with a playful mood, possibly electronic in nature. Then comes sounds of rustling and crinkling, suggestive of handling plastic or paper. Someone says "removed", followed by a series of similar utterances of "removed". Another male speaker utters "Ha! Gotcha Junior!" and then breaks into laughter, further punctuated by the sounds of movement and impact, with a suggestion of mischief.
